item.title: Remembering the Hotel San Remo: A Slice of Italy on the Las Vegas Strip
item.description:
A Different Kind of Vegas Vibe

The late 1980s and early 1990s were a period of dramatic transformation for the Las Vegas Strip. Mega-resorts were springing up, vying for attention with dazzling lights and extravagant themes. But nestled just east of the main drag, at 115 East Tropicana Avenue, was something a little different: the Hotel San Remo. Opened on July 1, 1989, developed by Japanese businessman Sukeaki Izumi, it offered a distinctive escapeâ€”a taste of the Italian Riviera in the Nevada desert. It replaced a Polynesian-themed resort, showing how rapidly the landscape of the Strip was evolving.
